page.title: 08Buxhall - Rural Lifestyle
page.content:
Most newcomers are attracted by the area's{rural}nature. The landscape is not outstanding but pleasant, the area quiet with a relaxing pace of life - summed up as "Don't rush me - I'm Suffolk". In choosing where to live the ideal of a 'rural area' appears the prime consideration. There is little choice of housing, few amenities and limited local employment
There are several opportunities for new residents to join in{village {activities}and those prepared to participate in events are welcomed. Although there is a limited social life for young people this is not seen as a disadvantage providing transport is available to nearby towns.
The{heavy dependance on cars}for everyday life is disliked by some.
